required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of Anesthesia on Patients Undergoing Surgery for Repair of a Thoracoabdominal Aneurysm.
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Anesthesia on Potential Cerebrospinal Fluid (CSF) and Serum Markers of Alzheimer's Disease.

brief_summary.textblock: Alzheimer's disease represents a growing public health problem in developed countries. Although the pathogenesis is not clearly defined, accumulation of extracellular amyloid, neurofibrillary tangles and neuronal loss are the hallmarks of Alzheimer's disease. The effect of anesthetic agents on changes in these proteins in humans is not well characterized, but in-vitro evidence suggests that anesthetic agents can accelerate potential pathogenic mechanisms, such as increasing amyloid formation or rates of apoptosis in cultured cells and increasing amyloid levels in mice. Human data on the effect of anesthetic agents on amyloid and tau proteins is limited to a small series of 11 patients and showed a significant increase in tau levels after exposure to anesthetics. In this study the investigators propose to measure CSF and serum biomarkers in a population of patients with normal CSF dynamics, who are undergoing surgery for repair of a thoracoabdominal aneurysm. The investigators will also obtain preliminary data on whether changes in CSF levels of these proteins are associated with postoperative delirium or cognitive change.

clinical_study.why_stopped: The data did not show clear results

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in Cerebrospinal Fluid (CSF) Levels of Tau
primary_outcome.time_frame: From insertion of spinal drain until removal
primary_outcome.description: Quantitative levels of tau will be measured using ELISA assay technique in pg/ml to compare the differences between the group receiving Propofol and the groups receiving Isoflurane.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in CSF Levels of Amyloid
primary_outcome.time_frame: From insertion of spinal drain until removal
primary_outcome.description: Quantitative levels of amyloid will be measured using ELISA assay technique in pg/ml to compare the differences between the group receiving Propofol and the groups receiving Isoflurane.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Delirium as Assessed by the Confusion Assessment Method (CAM)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after surgery and at 3 and 12 months post-op
secondary_outcome.description: Delirium was measured using the Confusion Assessment Method and the Confusion Assessment Method- Intensive Care Unit (CAM-ICU) based upon post-operative location of patient. The patients were divided into to two groups, patients that had an open thoracoabdominal aneurysm repair versus patients that had stenting of their aneurysms. Patients that had stenting of their aneurysms were also randomized to receive either Propofol or Isoflurane as for their anesthetic.

other_outcome.time_frame: From the start of the surgery to 24 hours post-op
other_outcome.description: Serum inflammatory markers will be compared per anesthetic group, Propofol versus Isoflurane. A sample of 10 individuals from each group will have biomarkers measured

arm_group.description: These will be patients undergoing an open repair of thoracoabdominal aneurysms with or without cardiopulmonary bypass. The will be observational only.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Stent graft repair of thoracoabdominal aneurysms isoflurane
arm_group.description: These patients are patients receiving repair of thoracoabdominal aneurysms using stent grafts. These patients will be randomized to receive isoflurane as their primary anesthetic.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Stent graft repair of thoracoabdominal aneurysms propofol
arm_group.description: These patients are patients receiving repair of thoracoabdominal aneurysms using stent grafts. These patients will be randomized to receive propofol as their primary anesthetic.

intervention.arm_group_label: Stent graft repair of thoracoabdominal aneurysms propofol
Stent graft repair of thoracoabdominal aneurysms isoflurane

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age 21-100 years of age
- Patients presenting for surgical repair of a thoracoabdominal aneurysm
- Insertion of a CSF spinal drain for clinically indicated reason
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with pre-existing delirium
- Inability to speak and understand English
- Severe hearing impairment, resulting in inability to converse
- Pregnancy. Pregnancy status will be assessed using a serum pregnancy test during preoperative evaluation as part of the standard of care.

group.title: Stent Graft Repair Propofol
group.description: Patients have a stent graft repair receiving intravenous anesthetic - patients will be induced with 1-2mg/kg of Propofol and maintained with 25-200 mcg/kg/min of Propofol. Propofol: Intravenous anesthetic

group.title: Stent Graft Repair Isoflurane
group.description: standard of care anesthetic - patients will be induced with 1-2 mg/kg of propofol and maintained with 0.5%-1.5% of isoflurane. isoflurane

group.title: Open Repair
group.description: These patient will receive no intervention, just standard of care.

group.title: Stent Graft Repair Propofol
group.description: Intravenous anesthetic - patients will be induced with 1-2mg/kg of Propofol and maintained with 25-200 mcg/kg/min of Propofol. Propofol: Intravenous anesthetic

group.title: Stent Graft Repair Isoflurane
group.description: standard of care anesthetic - patients will be induced with 1-2 mg/kg of propofol and maintained with 0.5%-1.5% of isoflurane. isoflurane

group.title: Open Repair
group.description: These patients received no intervention, just standard of care.

outcome.title: Changes in Cerebrospinal Fluid (CSF) Levels of Tau
outcome.description: Quantitative levels of tau will be measured using ELISA assay technique in pg/ml to compare the differences between the group receiving Propofol and the groups receiving Isoflurane.
outcome.time_frame: From insertion of spinal drain until removal
outcome.population: The data for changes in CSF levels of tau are not available. The study did not have adequate funding to appropriately measure these variables.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Delirium as Assessed by the Confusion Assessment Method (CAM)
outcome.description: Delirium was measured using the Confusion Assessment Method and the Confusion Assessment Method- Intensive Care Unit (CAM-ICU) based upon post-operative location of patient. The patients were divided into to two groups, patients that had an open thoracoabdominal aneurysm repair versus patients that had stenting of their aneurysms. Patients that had stenting of their aneurysms were also randomized to receive either Propofol or Isoflurane as for their anesthetic.
outcome.time_frame: Immediately after surgery and at 3 and 12 months post-op
outcome.population: Of the 6 patients that received an open thoracoabdominal aneurysm repair 2 were found to have delirium. Of the 5 subjects that had stenting and received Propofol as their primary anesthetic, 0 were found to have delirium. Of the 3 stenting subjects that received Isoflurane as their primary anesthetic, 1 were found to have delirium.

group.title: Delirum Status Post Open Thoracoabdominal Aneurysm Repair
group.description: These are participants that received open thoracoabdominal aneurysm repair instead of aneurysm stenting.

group.title: Delerium Staus Post Stenting of Aneuryms Propofol
group.description: These are participants that received stenting of thoracoabdominal aneurysms instead of an open repair and received Propofol as their primary anesthetic.

group.title: Stent Graft Aneurysm Repair Isoflurane
group.description: These are participants that received stenting of thoracoabdominal aneurysms instead of an open repair and received Isoflurane as their primary anesthetic.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Delirium as Assessed by the Confusion Assessment Method (CAM)
measure.description: Delirium was measured using the Confusion Assessment Method and the Confusion Assessment Method- Intensive Care Unit (CAM-ICU) based upon post-operative location of patient. The patients were divided into to two groups, patients that had an open thoracoabdominal aneurysm repair versus patients that had stenting of their aneurysms. Patients that had stenting of their aneurysms were also randomized to receive either Propofol or Isoflurane as for their anesthetic.
measure.population: Of the 6 patients that received an open thoracoabdominal aneurysm repair 2 were found to have delirium. Of the 5 subjects that had stenting and received Propofol as their primary anesthetic, 0 were found to have delirium. Of the 3 stenting subjects that received Isoflurane as their primary anesthetic, 1 were found to have delirium.

outcome.title: Serum Inflammatory Markers
outcome.description: Serum inflammatory markers will be compared per anesthetic group, Propofol versus Isoflurane. A sample of 10 individuals from each group will have biomarkers measured
outcome.time_frame: From the start of the surgery to 24 hours post-op
outcome.population: No data is available for serum inflammatory markers. The study did not have adequate funding to appropriately measure these variables.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
